newsitem.title: USA: Blue-chip stocks end slightly lower; pause after record highs.
newsitem.headline: Blue-chip stocks end slightly lower; pause after record highs.

text.p: Blue-chip stocks closed slightly lower Friday as the market looked tired following this week's spirited run to a series of record highs on Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan's comments about the economy.
Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow Jones industrial average ended 3.49 points lower at 8,113.44, pausing after three straight record closes.
In the broader market, advancing issues led declines by a thin margin on moderate volume of 516 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
